title: Fort Davis National Historic Site: People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People              People      African Americans in the Frontier Army    The Act of 1866 increased the size of the Regular Army, thus changing the course of military history by affording African Americans a permanent place in the Armed Forces of the United States. more     Second Lieutenant Henry O. Flipper    FIRST BLACK GRADUATE OF WEST POINT        Born into slavery at Thomasville, Georgia on March 21, 1856, Flipper became the first African American graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point. more      Interested in soldiers or units stationed at Fort Davis? Click the links below for our current information. Research is ongoing. *Note these are in PDF format; a version of Adobe is nessesary to view files. Soldiers who served at Fort Davis Units that served at Fort Davis
